briefdescription.para: Predefined iterator for computational efficiency.
Total length of conventional state vector.

detaileddescription.para: Total length of conventional state vector. For instance, for translational propagation, this is the length of the Cartesian state, whereas for rotational propagation, it is the length of the quaternion state.

briefdescription.para: Total length of propagated state vector.

detaileddescription.para: List of states that are not propagated in current numerical integration, i.e, for which current state is taken from the environment.

briefdescription.para: Boolean denoting whether the equations of motion are to be propagated or not.
Boolean denoting whether the variational equations are to be propagated or not.

detaileddescription.para: Start index in propagated matrix of the equations of motion (=0 if variational equations are not propagated).

briefdescription.para: Current state derivative, as computed by computeStateDerivative.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< std::shared_ptr< SingleStateTypeDerivative< StateScalarType, TimeType > > > stateDerivativeModels, const std::function< void(const TimeType, const std::unordered_map< IntegratedStateType, Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, 1 > > &, const std::vector< IntegratedStateType >) > environmentUpdateFunction, const std::shared_ptr< VariationalEquations > variationalEquations=std::shared_ptr< VariationalEquations >())
memberdef.name: DynamicsStateDerivativeModel

param.type: const std::vector< std::shared_ptr< SingleStateTypeDerivative< StateScalarType, TimeType > > >
const std::function< void(const TimeType, const std::unordered_map< IntegratedStateType, Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, 1 > > &, const std::vector< IntegratedStateType >) >

briefdescription.para: Derivative model constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Derivative model constructor. Takes state derivative model and environment updater. Constructor checks whether all models use the same environment updater.
stateDerivativeModels
Vector of state derivative models, with one entry for each type of dynamical equation.
environmentUpdateFunction
Function which is used to update time-dependent environment models to current time and state, must be consistent with member environment updaters of stateDerivativeModels entries.
variationalEquations
Object used for computing the state derivative in the variational equations

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the system state derivative.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the system state derivative, with settings as by last call to setPropagationSettings function. Dimensions of state must be consistent with these settings. Depending on the settings, this function may calculate the dynamical equations and/or variational equations for a subset of the dynamical equation types that are set in the stateDerivativeModels_ map.
time
Current time.
state
Current complete state.
Calculated state derivative.

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the system state derivative with double precision, regardless of template arguments.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the system state derivative with double precision, regardless of template arguments.
computeStateDerivative
time
Current time.
state
Current complete state.
Calculated state derivative.

briefdescription.para: Function to convert the state in the conventional form to the propagator-specific form.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert the state in the conventional form to the propagator-specific form. The conventional form is one that is typically used to represent the current state in the environment (e.g. Body class). For translational dynamics this is the Cartesian position and velocity).
outputState
State in 'conventional form'
time
Current time at which the state is valid.
State (outputState), converted to the 'propagator-specific form'

briefdescription.para: Function to convert the propagator-specific form of the state to the conventional form.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert the propagator-specific form of the state to the conventional form. The conventional form is one that is typically used to represent the current state in the environment (e.g. Body class). For translational dynamics this is the Cartesian position and velocity). In contrast to the convertCurrentStateToGlobalRepresentation function, this function does not provide the state in the inertial frame, but instead provides it in the frame in which it is propagated.
internalSolution
State in propagator-specific form (i.e. form that is used in numerical integration).
time
Current time at which the state is valid.
State (internalSolution), converted to the 'conventional form'

memberdef.argsstring: (std::map< TimeType, Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, 1 > > &convertedSolution, const std::map< TimeType, Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, 1 > > &rawSolution)
memberdef.name: convertNumericalStateSolutionsToOutputSolutions

param.type: const std::map< TimeType, Eigen::Matrix< StateScalarType, Eigen::Dynamic, 1 > > &

briefdescription.para: Function to convert a state history from propagator-specific form to the conventional form.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert a state history from propagator-specific form to the conventional form (not necessarily in inertial frame).
DynamicsStateDerivativeModel::convertToOutputSolution
convertedSolution
State history (rawSolution), converted to the 'conventional form' (by reference)
rawSolution
State history in propagator-specific form (i.e. form that is used in numerical integration).

briefdescription.para: Function to process the state vector during propagation.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to process the state vector during propagation.
unprocessedState
State before processing.
Processed state (returned by reference).

briefdescription.para: Function to process the state vector and variational equations during propagation.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to process the state vector and variational equations during propagation.
unprocessedState
State before processing.
Processed state (returned by reference).

briefdescription.para: Function to add variational equations to the state derivative model.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to add variational equations to the state derivative model.
variationalEquations
Object used for computing the state derivative in the variational equations

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< IntegratedStateType > &stateTypesToNotIntegrate, const bool evaluateDynamicsEquations, const bool evaluateVariationalEquations)
memberdef.name: setPropagationSettings

briefdescription.para: Function to set which segments of the full state to propagate.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to set which segments of the full state to propagate, i.e. whether to propagate the variational/dynamical equations, and which types of the dynamics to propagate.
stateTypesToNotIntegrate
Types of dynamics to propagate
evaluateDynamicsEquations
Boolean to denote whether the dynamical equations are to be propagated or not
evaluateVariationalEquations
Boolean to denote whether the variational equations are to be propagated or not

briefdescription.para: Function to update the settings of the state derivative models with new initial states.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to update the settings of the state derivative models with new initial states. This function is called when using, for instance and Encke propagator for the translational dynamics, and the reference orbits are modified.
initialBodyStates
New initial state for the full propagated dynamics.

memberdef.argsstring: (const StateType &state, const TimeType &time, const bool stateIncludesVariationalState)
memberdef.name: convertCurrentStateToGlobalRepresentationPerType

briefdescription.para: Function to convert the to the conventional form in the global frame per dynamics type.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to convert the propagator-specific form of the state to the conventional form in the global frame, split by dynamics type. This function updates the currentStatesPerTypeInConventionalRepresentation_ to the current state and time. The conventional form is one that is typically used to represent the current state in the environment (e.g. Body class). For translational dynamics this is the Cartesian position and velocity). The inertial frame is typically the barycenter with J2000/ECLIPJ2000 orientation, but may differ depending on simulation settings
state
State in propagator-specific form (i.e. form that is used in numerical integration).
time
Current time at which the state is valid.
stateIncludesVariationalState
Boolean defining whether the stae includes the state transition/sensitivity matrices

briefdescription.para: Top-level class responsible for single complete function evaluation of dynamics state derivative.

detaileddescription.para: Top-level class responsible for single complete function evaluation of dynamics state derivative. This class contains both the EnvironmentUpdater and list of SingleStateTypeDerivative derived classes that define the full state derivative function, which fully evaluated by calling the computeStateDerivative function.
